newsitem.title: GERMANY: REXRODT SAYS EURO MUST AND WILL BE AS STABLE AS DM.
newsitem.headline: REXRODT SAYS EURO MUST AND WILL BE AS STABLE AS DM.

text.p: German Economics Minister Guenter Rexrodt said on Thursday the planned euro currency had to be as stable as the deutschemark and added the government would do all it could to ensure it met the criteria for currency union.
"It (the euro) must and will be as stable as the deutschemark," Rexrodt told parliament during a debate on the government's annual economic report.
"The federal government will do everything in its power to fulfill the Maastricht criteria," he said.
Rexrodt also said the recovery of Europe's largest economy would continue this year and that the government saw no reason to change its forecast for economic growth.
"We are standing by our forecast of 2.5 percent economic growth," Rexrodt told parliament.
"The German economy has been back on the growth track since the spring of 1996. All indications show that this will continue in 1997."
